property.name: text
property.value:
This model solves Tower of Hanoi puzzle using the ActorRecursion actor. A tower of disks initially stacked in increasing size on the source tower shall be transferred to the destination tower, moving only at one disk at a time and never a larger one onto a smaller through the third tower.
The number of disks can be adjusted through the parameter numberOfDisks. The three towers are indexed as 0,1,2. The animation speed can be adjusted through the parameter interpolationFactor.

svg.text: This example requires Java3D. If you do not have it installed, you can get it from: http://java.sun.com/products/java-media/3D/

property.name: text
property.value: This is the basic recursive algorithm. If there is only one disk to move, simply move that disk. Otherwise if there are N (>1) disks to move from source tower i to destination tower j through intermediate tower k, represented as array (N, i, j), it can be decomposed into three steps: (N-1, i, k), (1, i, j), (N-1, k, j).

property.name: text
property.value: This part basically simulates the disk moving and does the book keeping. It represents disks on three towers with three arrays. On receiving each moving command which has the form (1, i, j), meaning moving one disk from tower i to tower j, it outputs the index of the disk that is to be moved, the moving vector and stores the status of disks on each tower after moving.

property.name: Director
property.doc: Simple director that executes actors in the order in which they were created.
